page.title: 02SALISBURY CATHEDRAL & CLOSE
page.content:
The Cathedral's magnificent 404' Spire the tallest in the country, can be seen from all roads entering the city. In 1984 over 500,000 Tourists, visited the Cathedral, attracted by the spire and the peaceful Close with its lawns and historic houses. This year the number will increase. The money they contribute helps raise the Â£1400 needed daily to run the cathedral and keep it a living worshipping community
Recent artistic additions to the Close and Cathedral are'The Walking Madonna' by Elizabeth Frink and a new stained- glass East window by Gabriel Loire of Chartres, dedicated to Prisoners of Conscience. Both of these have caused controversy partly because of the cost and partly because some people have difficulty understanding them though agree the window colour is glorious.
